question: Pneumonic plague transmission route:
exp: Ans. (c) Inhalation. Ref: K. Park 23rd ed. / 292-94* Pneumonic plague, a severe type of lung infection* It is one of three main forms of plague, all of which are caused by the bacterium Yersinia pestis.* Primary pneumonic plague results from inhalation of fine infective droplets and can be transmitted from human to human without involvement of fleas or animals.
